meat.p:
Hi, I'm April Wang, aka 王奕. I am a thesis-based MSc student in the Human-Computer Interaction Lab at the School of Computing Science, Simon Fraser University, advised by Dr.Chilana. My research interests focus on using HCI techniques to lower the learning barriers for people without professional knowledge in a particular subject.

Before starting my journey in HCI research, I finished my Bachelor's degree in College of Computer Science and Technology, Zhejiang Univerisity, China. With a major in Digital Media and Network Technology, I received interdisciplinary training in multimedia processing, game engineering and human interface design. In addition, I have previously worked in Intel and Alibaba as a User Experience Design Intern, and NetEase Games as a Junior Software Developer.

PACM-CSCW 2017: Vermette, L., Dembla, S., Wang, A., McGrenere, J., & Chilana, P. 2017. Social CheatSheet: An Interactive Community-Curated Information Overlay for Web Applications. Proceedings of the ACM : Human-Computer Interaction (1,1), Computer-Supported Cooperative Work and Social Computing (CSCW) [to appear].

ICER 2017: Wang, A., & Chilana, P. 2017. Investigating Learning Strategies of Conversational Programmers. ACM Conference on International Computing Education Research (ICER), Tacoma, WA, August 2017 [conference poster].
